title: Nobuo Kawakami
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Kawakami was born in <a href="Saitama%20%28city%29">Saitama</a> on October 4, 1947. After graduating from <a href="Rikkyo%20University">Rikkyo University</a>, he joined <a href="Kashiwa%20Reysol">Hitachi</a> in 1971. The club won the league champions in <a href="1972%20Japan%20Soccer%20League">1972</a>. The club also won <a href="1972%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1972</a> and <a href="1975%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1975 Emperor's Cup</a>. He retired in 1978. He played 128 games and scored 7 goals in the league. He was selected Best Eleven in <a href="1972%20Japan%20Soccer%20League">1972</a> and <a href="1975%20Japan%20Soccer%20League">1975</a>.
National team career.
On July 31, 1970, when Kawakami was a <a href="Rikkyo%20University">Rikkyo University</a> student, he debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20football%20team">Hong Kong</a>. He played at <a href="Football%20at%20the%201970%20Asian%20Games">1970</a> and <a href="Football%20at%20the%201974%20Asian%20Games">1974 Asian Games</a>. He was also selected Japan for <a href="1974%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28AFC%20and%20OFC%29">1974</a>, <a href="1978%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28AFC%20and%20OFC%29">1978 World Cup qualification</a> and <a href="Football%20at%20the%201976%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20qualification">1976 Summer Olympics qualification</a>. He played 41 games for Japan until 1977.
